meanings.definition: Capable of being crossed by wading.
meanings.sent1: The shallow stream was easily fordable, allowing us to walk across.
meanings.sent2: The river was fordable, so we decided to wade through it.
meanings.sent3: The fordable creek made for a refreshing walk on a hot day.
meanings.sent4: The fordable pond seemed like a gateway to a hidden world.
meanings.sent5: The fordable brook sparkled in the sunlight, inviting us to explore its banks.

meanings.definition: Able to be traversed or crossed.
meanings.sent1: The mountain path was not very fordable, making the journey difficult.
meanings.sent2: The bridge was not fordable due to the collapsed section.
meanings.sent3: The fordable road twisted and turned, confusing the travelers.
meanings.sent4: The fordable trail led us through a dense forest of towering trees.
meanings.sent5: The fordable path meandered through fields of wildflowers, creating a picturesque scene.
